fol.165r
May it please y
r
good L. having sent my
L.
T
re
r
an other l
re
intercepted, I have here
inclosed a copie bothe of
t
& of mine owne
knowing no other matter worth the writing
to y
r
L. from the Hague. Ap
r
4 1594.
Y
r
L. most h umbly bounden Tho. Bodley
At the closing hereof I understood the
ticuler
discourse of the last conspiracie in
Scotland
the
ligger
Ambassadour both reported it alike
for as much as doth concerne
e confession of
Bawirie. But the
Coronell
upon it doth
exaggerate the matter in solliciting the
states for some p
nt
assistance as if the
K.
for his security had never more nede:
whereas the Ambassador tells me plainely
but under many benedicities
t
the K:
necessitie is lesse then before & sheweth me
t
Huntlie
&
Erroll
have given caution to
de
te the country, &
t
Bothwell
is allso
goeing. and thus I have found a Rowland
to oppose against Oliver: & one Ambassa-
dor against an other.
